item.title: Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 And Netflix’s Stranger Things Take To The Skies In New Crossover
item.content:encoded:
PlayStation has revealed an odd but intriguing crossover for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024, as the popular flight-sim game is bringing Netflix’s Stranger Things to the game, and in this day and age, stranger things have happened.

Stranger Things Season 5 is all the rage right now. Netflix’s hit show is into its fifth and final season, bringing down the curtain on one of the most-watched TV shows ever. In the gaming world, Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 has launched on PlayStation 5, marking the first appearance for the franchise on a Sony console.

Someone behind the scenes was clearly interested to see what would happen if you joined these opposing forces together, and now there’s an answer.

You Can Visit Iconic Stranger Things Location In Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024

You’ll be able to explore Hawkins like never before. See and visit real locations from the show in the new Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024: Stranger Things expansion, available December 9.

A PlayStation Blog said: “You will be able to explore a highly detailed map and recreation of the town with more than 40 iconic locations made famous by the show.”

Some of the locations include Starcourt Mall, Hawkins Middle School, and Hawkins Junkyard.

The expansion includes five new missions taking you around the town in a Bell UH-1H Huey helicopter, and you need to rescue residents in danger. It makes sense for any game right now to cash in on the Stranger Things final season hype, but a Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 wouldn’t have been near the top of your lists!

Head on over to the free-to-join Insider Gaming Discord Server, where you can discuss all things MSFS 2024, and there’s even a Movies, TV & Music thread where a new Stranger Things conversation has your name on it.

If you’re interested in trying this expansion out for yourself, check out Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024’s PS5 Price.

item.title: Black Ops 7 Warzone Camo Challenges—All BO7 Warzone Camos & How To Get Them
item.content:encoded:
Warzone has officially implemented Black Ops 7 into the mode following the start of season one, bringing a whole host of weapons to choose from and exclusive camos to unlock.

The camo grind is a popular pastime for Call of Duty players, and there’s more than ever to secure with exclusive camos available in Warzone, Zombies, Multiplayer, and the Co-op Campaign.

If you’re on the hunt to unlock all the available Warzone Camos, this guide has all the details and tasks for every weapon available.

All Black Ops 7 Warzone Camos & Challenges

There are 12 Camos to unlock for each weapon in Black Ops 7 Warzone, with nine Military Camos and three Special Camos to earn, with Mastery Camos in addition to those.

Military Camos have the same requirements across the board, with some exceptions, while Special Camos have specific challenges to unlock.

Finally, there are also Mastery Camos to earn, which require unlocking all the Camos available on specific guns.

All Military Camo Challenges

There are nine Military Camos to earn in Black Ops Warzone, with the requirements being the same across all weapons and requiring Eliminations.

Unlike the other game modes, there are no exceptions to this for the likes of Melee weapons and Launchers, all of which still require Eliminations in Warzone.

All of the Military Camops below are available to earn across every weapon in Black Ops 7 Co-Op Campaign, with similar requirements.

All Warzone Mastery Camo Challenges

The section below is broken down into specific weapon types to make it easier to navigate.

BO7 Assault Rifle Camo Challenges

BO7 SMG Camo Challenges

BO7 LMG Camo Challenges

BO7 Shotgun Camo Challenges

BO7 Marksman Rifle Camo Challenges

BO7 Sniper Rifle Camo Challenges

BO7 Pistol Camo Challenges

BO7 Launcher Camo Challenges

BO7 Melee Weapon Camo Challenges

Are you planning to grind for all the Warzone-exclusive Camos in Black Ops 7? Share your progress in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Black Ops 7, take a look at the complete list of achievements and trophies, and find out how to unlock every weapon and Perk.

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem PSN Listing Reveals Leon Kennedy Key Art
item.content:encoded:
There have been back-and-forth rumors for weeks about Leon Kennedy appearing in Resident Evil Requiem, either as a playable character or as a part of the main story. The PlayStation Store seems to have finally given us an official Leon Kennedy answer for Requiem.

Leon Kennedy is one of the pillars of the Resident Evil franchise. He’s been a playable main character across multiple Resi titles—such as Resident Evil 2 and 4—and with Resident Evil Requiem taking us back to Raccoon City, the question has been asked since day one—is Leon Kennedy ready for one last zombie rodeo?

Leon Kennedy Will Be In Resident Evil Requiem

If you buy Resident Evil Requiem through the PlayStation Store, you’ll be able to check your purchase and see how long it is until the game goes live.

However, if you look closely at the Requiem game art image, while you can clearly see Grace Ashcroft, there’s a huge Leon Kennedy avatar in the background.

If he weren’t in the game, he wouldn’t be in this image. It’s that simple, folks. This also confirms what Dusk Golem has been saying for months. You can see the evidence below, and it’s reportedly been confirmed by multiple people who’ve pre-purchased Resident Evil Requiem’s Standard Edition.

This all but confirms the return of the legendary character. It doesn’t necessarily mean Leon will be playable in Requiem, though, so rein in those expectations for now. It would be wise to assume Leon is playable in Requiem, and if so, it’ll be interesting to see how Capcom switches back and forth between Grace and Leon, or if you have the option to play the entire game as either protagonist.

What do you think of this reveal? Was Leon always going to be in the game? Let us know what you think of this tidbit, what it means for Resident Evil Requiem, and if you’re excited for the game. You can do so through the free-to-join Insider Gaming Discord Server.

Also, if you missed it, check out New Resident Evil Requiem Gameplay Shown Exclusively In Japan.
